item.title: Consumers in the Asia Pacific region are more concerned about the security of their computer data than their mobile payment data
item.description:
New benchmark data from ACI Worldwide and the Aite Group reveals that consumers in the Asia Pacific region are more worried about the security of their financial and payment information on computers compared to mobile wallets. This conclusion comes from their Global Consumer Survey: Consumer Trust and Security Perceptions report. The study, which surveyed over 6,000 consumers across 20 countries, found that only 46% of Asia Pacific consumers trust businesses, such as restaurants and retailers, to safeguard their financial data...

item.title: Companies that experience data breaches in the Asia Pacific region are unlikely to be forgiven
item.description:
New research from SafeNet reveals that data breaches significantly influence customer trust. The global study, including participants from Japan and Australia, found that 65% wouldn’t patronize a business that experienced a financial data breach, compromising credit card details, bank accounts, or login credentials. SafeNet’s Q2 Breach Level Index reported 237 data breaches from April to June 2014, exposing over 175 million records globally. These findings highlight the impact of data breaches on customer loyalty and revenue...
